page.title: 12 Winsford Rock Salt Mine
page.content: There is a working{Salt Mine}in {Winsford Cheshire.It is operated by ICI Mond Division.The mine was first opened in{1844}but production was low until the{1950's.} As motor transport increased so did the need for ICI rock salt to clear the roads of ice and snow in winter. The actual origin of the mine is uncertain.When the mine was first worked in the nineteenth century,picks and shovels were used to get the salt. Also, the only light down the mine was provided by candles. Since then many improvements have been made, better equipment and also better mining techniques. Today Winsford rock salt mine has lots of new modern equipment and a special way to produce{two and a {quarter million tons of salt per year.
